# Draft:Deepak Talwar

Deepak Talwar (born 28 May 1978) is an Indian politician and businessman, currently serving as the Mandal President of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Bagha Purana, Punjab. Talwar has been credited with strengthening the BJP's presence in a region where it had historically limited influence. He has held this position for two terms, with his most recent election in 2025.
Early life and background
Deepak Talwar was born on 28 May 1978 in Bagha Purana, Punjab. He is the son of Ashok Talwar, who served as the Chairman of the Punjab Khadi and Village Industries Board. Raised in a politically active household, Talwar was exposed to community service and leadership from a young age.
Business career
Outside politics, Talwar is engaged in business activities in the Moga district. His involvement in local enterprise has contributed to employment and economic development in Bagha Purana. His background in business has shaped his approach to political leadership, emphasizing grassroots development and self-reliance.
Political career
Talwar formally joined the Bharatiya Janata Party and rose quickly through its organizational ranks. In 2023, he was elected as the Mandal President of BJP in Bagha Purana, a position that had previously been relatively low-profile in the area.
Under his leadership, BJP's visibility in Bagha Purana increased significantly. He launched membership drives, organized public outreach programs, and facilitated party events aimed at strengthening the BJP's grassroots presence. His leadership led to wider recognition and support across diverse voter groups.
In 2025, he was re-elected as Mandal President, reflecting his continued popularity and organizational effectiveness.
Community and social initiatives
Talwar has also been involved in community and cultural activities, including religious programs and social awareness campaigns. He has advocated for traditional Punjabi values and supported causes such as cow protection, cleanliness drives, and youth engagement programs.
Languages and public presence
Talwar is multilingual, fluent in Hindi, Punjabi, and English. He maintains an active presence at public events and through BJP organizational channels.
